data.title: Calling All Sports Fans! Test Your Knowledge with These 125 Sports Trivia Questions (Plus Answers!)
data.meta_description: Test your knowledge with these sports trivia questions and answers, like baseball and basketball trivia questions. We include hard or easy questions, all with answers, of course!
data.text:
Ranging from hockey to football, everyone has a favorite sport they love to watch. But how much do you actually know about the ins and outs of the sports world? Whether you’re a newbie or a regular sports buff, this big list of general sports trivia questions will put your knowledge to the test.

These current sports trivia questions with answers range from easy sports trivia for kids to hard sports trivia that even the biggest fans might now know. Plus, they're broken down into different sports trivia quiz categories, so baseball lovers can find tricky baseball trivia questions, ballers can find interesting basketball sports trivia questions, football fanatics can find cool football trivia facts, Super Bowl trivia and more.

Challenge your family and friends to a trivia game night with these 125 random sports trivia questions and answers, and get ready to see their competitive streak start showing. Whether you get a lot of them right (...or not!), your trivia night is sure to be a home run, a slam dunk, a touchdown—whatever you want to call it!

General Sports Trivia

1. Question: What’s the diameter of a basketball hoop in inches?

Answer: 18 inches.

2. Question: The Olympics are held every how many years?

Answer: 4 years.

3. Question: What sport is best known as the ‘king of sports’?

Answer: Soccer.

4. Question: What do you call it when a bowler makes three strikes in a row?

Answer: Turkey.

5. Question: What are the two national sports of Canada?

Answer: Lacrosse in the summer, ice hockey in the winter.

6. Question: How many dimples does an average golf ball have?

Answer: Between 300-500.

7. Question: What country has competed the most times in the Summer Olympics yet hasn’t won a gold medal?

Answer: The Philippines.

8. Question: The classic 1980 movie called Raging Bull is about which real-life boxer?

Answer: Jake LaMotta.

9. Question: The Triple Crown award is given to a horse that wins which three races?

Answer: The Kentucky Derby, Preakness Stakes, and Belmont Stakes.

10. Question: In the 1971 Olympics, Nadia Comaneci was the first gymnast to score a perfect score. What country was she representing?

Answer: Romania.

11. Question: Who has won more tennis grand slam titles, Venus Williams or Serena Williams?

Answer: Serena Williams.

12. Question: Where will the 2028 Summer Olympics be held?

Answer: Los Angeles

13. Question: Which boxer fought against Muhammad Ali and won?

Answer: Joe Frazier.

14. Question: Which golf tournament did Tiger Woods win by 12 strokes cementing his first-ever major championship win?

Answer: The Masters.

15. Question: How many medals did China win at the Beijing Olympics?

Answer: 100.

Easy Sports Trivia

16. Question: What does NBA stand for?

Answer: National Basketball Association.

17. Question: In motor racing, what color is the flag they wave to indicate the winner?

Answer: Checkered flag.

18. Question: How many holes are played in an average round of golf?

Answer: 18.

19. Question: What color are the goalposts in football?

Answer: Yellow.

20. Question: How long is a marathon?

Answer: 26.2 miles.

21. Question: In what game is “love” a score?

Answer: Tennis.

22. Question: What sport is a lot like softball?

Answer: Baseball.

23. Question: In meters, how big is an Olympic-sized swimming pool?

Answer: 50 meters long and 25 meters wide.

24. Question: In football, how many points does a touchdown hold?

Answer: 6 points.

25. Question: How many players are on a baseball team?

Answer: 9 players.

26. Question: In soccer, what body part can’t touch the ball?

Answer: Hands.

27. Question: What sporting equipment is used for striking a tennis ball?

Answer: Tennis racquet.

28. Question: Which sport uses a net, a racket, and a shuttlecock?

Answer: Badminton.

29. Question: Which of the following sports does not use a ball? Golf, tennis, hockey, or polo?

Answer: Hockey.

30. Question: What type of race is the Tour de France?

Answer: Bicycle race.

Hard Sports Trivia

31. Question: How many sports were included in the 2008 Summer Olympics?

Answer: 28.

32. Question: A sporting event is held every year on Memorial Day. What is it?

Answer: Indianapolis 500

33. Question: What number sits to the right of the number ‘20’ on a standard dartboard?

Answer: 1.

34. Question: In what year were women allowed to compete in the modern Olympic games and in what sports?

Answer: 1900. Of the 997 athletes, 22 women competed in five sports: tennis, sailing, croquet, equestrianism and golf.

35. Question: Basketball player, Scottie Pippen, has a word tattooed on his forearm. What does it say?

Answer: Pip.

36. Question: What sport is Bela Karolyi known for coaching?

Answer: Women’s gymnastics.

37. Question: What is the only sport to be played on the moon?

Answer: A round of golf.

38. Question: How old was Tiger Woods when he won the Masters?

Answer: 21.

39. Question: In which winter sport are the terms “stale fish” and “mule kick” used?

Answer: Snowboarding.

40. Question: How long is the free skate in figure skating?

Answer: Four and a half minutes for men, four minutes for women.

41. Question: Who was the first president to throw the ceremonial first pitch at a Major League Baseball game?

Answer: William Howard Taft.

42. Question: How many minutes was the longest recorded point in the history of tennis?

Answer: 29 minutes.

43. Question: During the first-ever modern Olympics, what were the first placers awarded with?

Answer: Silver medals.

44. Question: How many Olympic games were held in countries that no longer exist?

Answer: 3.

45. Question: What NFL team was originally called the ‘New York Titans’?

Answer: The New York Jets.

46. Question: What is the only team in the NFL to neither host nor play in the Super Bowl?

Answer: Cleveland Browns.

47. Question: How much does an NFL football weigh?

Answer: 1 pound.

48. Question: This player was the first-ever openly gay person to be drafted by an NFL team. What was his name?

Answer: Michael Sam.

49. Question: What NFL team lost the first Super Bowl in 1970?

Answer: Minnesota Vikings.

50. Question: Which NFL team has their logo located on only one side of their helmets?

Answer: Pittsburgh Steelers.

51. Question: What team is considered the oldest in the NFL?

Answer: Arizona Cardinals

52. Question: What team won the first-ever football game played at night?

Answer: Philadelphia Athletics.

53. Question: Which team has the record of scoring the most points in a single Super Bowl?

Answer: The San Francisco 49ers.

54. Question: What team won 3 Super Bowls in the 1990s?

Answer: The Dallas Cowboys.

55. Question: What wide receiver caused a sensation during his rookie season with a one-handed catch?

Answer: Odell Beckham Jr.

Basketball Sports Trivia

56. Question: Which basketball player was Michael Jordan nicknamed after when he was in high school?

Answer: Magic Johnson.

57. Question: What team won the very first NBA game in 1946?

Answer: The New York Knicks.

58. Question: Who was the youngest player to score 10,000 points in the NBA?

Answer: LeBron James.

59. Question: Who was the first WNBA player to dunk in a playoff game?

Answer: Brittney Griner.

60. Question: What team owns the longest winning streak in NBA history?

Answer: Los Angeles Lakers.

61. Question: When he was just in eighth grade, what NBA coach appeared on Late Night with David Letterman?

Answer: Frank Vogel.

62. Question: Who was the first NBA player to test positive for COVID-19?

Answer: Rudy Gobert.

63. Question: Who was the first NBA player to shatter a backboard?

Answer: Chuck Connors.

64. Question: What are the two states in the United States that have yet to send a team to the NCAA?

Answer: Alaska and Maine.

65. Question: Who was the first-ever NBA player to score 2,000 points in a single season?

Answer: George Yardley.

Baseball Sports Trivia

66. Question: What material was first used to cover baseballs?

Answer: Cowhide.

67. Question: Who was the first Major League player to pitch a ball over 100 mph?

Answer: Nolan Ryan.

68. Question: What is the name of the fictitious Minor League Baseball team on The Simpsons?

Answer: The Springfield Isotopes.

69. Question: What team gets the advantage of the first bat?

Answer: The visiting team.

70. Question: What female pitcher once struck out Babe Ruth and Lou Gehrig?

Answer: Jackie Mitchell.

71. Question: Who was the first baseball player to appear on a Wheaties box?

Answer: Lou Gehrig.

72. Question: During which inning is "Take Me Out to the Ballgame" traditionally sung?

Answer: The 7th inning.

73. Question: What retired basketball player tried out for the Chicago White Sox in 1994?

Answer: Michael Jordan.

74. Question: What is the most stolen base?

Answer: Second base.

75. Question: What are the Minnesota Twins named after?

Answer: The Twin Cities.

Soccer Sports Trivia

76. Question: What African country was the first ever to qualify for a World Cup?

Answer: Egypt.

77. Question: What is the record for red cards given in a single soccer game?

Answer: 36.

78. Question: What is a soccer field called?

Answer: A pitch.

79. Question: How old was the youngest professional soccer player?

Answer: 13.

80. Question: Who was the first British player to win league titles in four countries?

Answer: David Beckham.

81. Question: Which country won the first women's World Cup?

Answer: The United States.

82. Question: Which type of football is another term for soccer?

Answer: Association football.

83. Question: Who won the first two FIFA Women's World Player of the Year Awards?

Answer: Mia Hamm.

84. Question: What was the fastest goal in World Cup history?

Answer: 11 seconds.

85. Question: What is the only country to have played in every single soccer World Cup?

Answer: Brazil.

Sports Trivia For Kids

86. Question: What do the rings in the Olympics represent?

Answer: The continents of the world.

87. Question: What sport is called the “sport of kings”?

Answer: Polo.

88. Question: What is the very center of a target called in archery or darts?

Answer: Bullseye.

89. Question: What was the first city to host the Olympics thrice?

Answer: London.

90. Question: What two teams share the record for the most NBA titles?

Answer: Boston Celtics and the LA Lakers.

91. Question: What team does LeBron James play for?

Answer: Los Angeles Lakers.

92. Question: What do the letters BMX stand for?

Answer: Bicycle Moto X.

93. Question: In baseball, how many strikes does it take before the umpire calls out?

Answer: 3.

94. Question: Which MLB player was better known as “The Bambino”?

Answer: Babe Ruth.

95. Question: Which NFL team has a lightning bolt on the players’ helmet?

Answer: Los Angeles Chargers.

96. Question: In football, where do you have to go in order to score a touchdown?

Answer: The end zone.

97. Question: Where did the first ancient Olympic games take place?

Answer: Greece.

98. Question: What measurement measures how far runners run?

Answer: Distance.

99. Question: When an Olympic athlete wins first place, what color medal do they get?

Answer: Gold.

100. Question: What sport starts with a tip-off or jump ball?

Answer: Basketball.

101. Question: How many rings are there on the Olympic flag?

Answer: 5.

Women's Sports Trivia

102. Question: Who was the first woman to compete in the Indianapolis 500?

Answer: Janet Guthrie.

103. Question: Who is the most decorated gymnast of all time, with 37 world and Olympic medals to her name?

Answer: Simone Biles.

104. Question: Which female tennis player holds the record for the most Grand Slam singles titles?

Answer: Margaret Court.

105. Question: Who was the first woman to run the Boston Marathon as an officially registered participant?

Answer: Kathrine Switzer.

106. Question: What year did women's soccer become an official Olympic sport?

Answer: 1996.

107. Question: Who is the first Black woman to win an Olympic gold medal?

Answer: Alice Coachman.

108. Question: Who was the first woman to climb Mt. Everest?

Answer: Junko Tabei.

109. Question: Which female golfer has the most LPGA Tour wins in history?

Answer: Kathy Whitworth.

110. Question: Who was the first U.S. woman to win a gold medal at the World Gymnastics Championships?

Answer: Marcia Frederick.

111. Question: Who was the first female athlete to appear on the cover of Wheaties cereal boxes?

Answer: Babe Didrikson.

112. Question: Who is the most decorated female Winter Olympian of all time?

Answer: Marit Bjørgen.

113. Question: Who is the most decorated female Summer Olympian of all time?

Answer: Larisa Latynina.

114. Question: Which female basketball player broke Pete Maravich's record to become the all-time highest-scoring Division One NCAA player?

Answer: Caitlin Clark.

115. Question: Which female boxer won an Olympic gold medal in the inaugural women's boxing event at the 2012 London Olympics?

Answer: Nicola Adams.

116. Question: Who was the first female athlete to win the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine?

Answer: Gerty Cori.

117. Question: Which female athlete has won the most World Championships gold medals in track and field?

Answer: Allyson Felix.

118. Question: Which female athlete holds the record for the most Wimbledon singles titles in the Open Era?

Answer: Martina Navratilova.

119. Question: Who was the first female athlete to dunk in an official NCAA basketball game?

Answer: Georgeann Wells.

120. Question: Who is the first female athlete to win gold medals in both the Winter and Summer Paralympic Games?

Answer: Alana Nichols.

121. Question: Who was the first woman to play in a men's professional baseball league, signing with the minor league team the Chattanooga Lookouts?

Answer: Jackie Mitchell.

122. Question: Who is the all-time leading goal scorer in FIFA Women's World Cup history?

Answer: Michelle Akers.

123. Question: Who is the most decorated female swimmer in Olympic history, having won a total of 7 gold medals at the 1988 Seoul Olympics?

Answer: Kristin Otto.

124. Question: Who was the first woman to swim the English Channel?

Answer: Gertrude Ederle.

125. Question: Who is the first woman to serve as a full-time NFL coach?

Answer: Kathryn Smith.

Check out...
